pullrequest.title: Allow for h5 array compression passthrough arguments in save_result_array(s)

content.raw:
No objections at all to this idea, though since it is in fact passing through all keyword arguments (which is useful for allowing any other pass-through of kwargs people might want in addition to compression), how about just calling it `**kwargs` instead of `**compress_args`?

Adding a tiny docstring to the two methods saying that kwargs are passed through to create_dataset would also be an improvement. (I know there are not many docstrings anywhere but I'm trying to create precedent :p).

A while ago I was wondering how we could turn on compression more globally. It would be nice if there were just a 'enable compression' setting in labconfig that compressed everything. I might think about this more in the future, perhaps subclassing h5py.File to compress by default and using that everywhere would be the way to go. We are already monkey-patching h5py.File to do locking, perhaps that should be done with a subclass too.
content.html:
No objections at all to this idea, though since it is in fact passing through all keyword arguments (which is useful for allowing any other pass-through of kwargs people might want in addition to compression), how about just calling it **kwargs instead of **compress_args?

Adding a tiny docstring to the two methods saying that kwargs are passed through to create_dataset would also be an improvement. (I know there are not many docstrings anywhere but I'm trying to create precedent :p).

A while ago I was wondering how we could turn on compression more globally. It would be nice if there were just a 'enable compression' setting in labconfig that compressed everything. I might think about this more in the future, perhaps subclassing h5py.File to compress by default and using that everywhere would be the way to go. We are already monkey-patching h5py.File to do locking, perhaps that should be done with a subclass too.

pullrequest.title: Allow for h5 array compression passthrough arguments in save_result_array(s)

content.raw: Fantastic. Thanks for helping document things! Merging.
content.html: Fantastic. Thanks for helping document things! Merging.

pullrequest.title: Allow for h5 array compression passthrough arguments in save_result_array(s)

content.raw:
Both are good changes. I also tried to make the docstrings describe the function operation as a whole since I was in there anyway.

As for global changes, that is probably a good idea, though I would worry about all the extra time spent compressing/decompressing small datasets where there is very little space saving benefit to be had. Obviously, maintaining more granular control at the same time would be nice.
content.html:
Both are good changes. I also tried to make the docstrings describe the function operation as a whole since I was in there anyway.

As for global changes, that is probably a good idea, though I would worry about all the extra time spent compressing/decompressing small datasets where there is very little space saving benefit to be had. Obviously, maintaining more granular control at the same time would be nice.

pullrequest.title: Allow for h5 array compression passthrough arguments in save_result_array(s)

content.raw: For people with spinning hard disks, I'm under the impression that compression can actually speed up reading and writing, as the extra time compressing/decompressing is made up for on saving on data transmission. So it would be win-win. But I would want to profile it in a range of cases before turning it on by default. Something for the future though.
content.html: For people with spinning hard disks, I'm under the impression that compression can actually speed up reading and writing, as the extra time compressing/decompressing is made up for on saving on data transmission. So it would be win-win. But I would want to profile it in a range of cases before turning it on by default. Something for the future though.
